name: Scan Alert
description: Scan Alert events report the start, completion, and results of a scan. The scan event includes the number of items that were scanned and the number of detections that were resolved.

name.description: The name of the scan job.

1.name: Manual
1.description: The scan was manually initiated by the user or administrator.

2.name: Scheduled
2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.

3.name: Updated Definitions
3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.

4.name: Quarantined Items
4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.

5.name: Attached Media
5.description: The scan was triggered by the attachment of removable media.

6.name: User Logon
6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.

7.name: ELAM
7.description: The scan was triggered by an Early Launch Anti-Malware (ELAM) detection.

uid.name: Scan UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the scan job.

command_uid.description: The command identifier that is associated with this Scan event; required if the scan was initiated by a command.

end_time.description: The end time of the scan job.

4.name: Duration Violation
4.description: The allocated scan time was insufficient to complete the requested scan.

5.name: Pause Violation
5.description: The scan was paused, either by the user or by program constraints (e.g. scans that are suspended during certain time intervals), and not resumed within the allotted time.

6.name: Error
6.description: The scan could not be completed due to an internal error.

8.name: Resumed
8.description: The scan was resumed from the pause point.

9.name: Restarted
9.description: The scan restarted from the beginning of the file enumeration.

policy.description: The policy associated with this Scan event; required if the scan was initiated by a policy.

start_time.description: The start time of the scan job.

time.description: The time when the scan report were created.

total.description: The total number of items that were scanned; zero if no items were scanned.
